alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 6:43PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Nuisance flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Cabarrus. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams including woodlands, farmland, low-water crossings, parks, greenways, golf courses, campgrounds, and boat-access areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 637 PM EST, The Rocky River from Harrisburg to Georgeville to Midland is out of its banks and causing nuisance flooding of adjacent low-lying areas following heavy rainfall from earlier Wednesday. The river is currently at 14.7 feet and is rising slowly. At these levels, the Rocky River is flooding woodland and farmland near the river and backwater effects may be causing lowland flooding along adjacent tributaries, including along Back Creek near Pharr Mill Rd. The Rocky River is expected to crest between 15.0 and 15.5 feet later tonight and gradually recede into Thursday morning, falling below the Action/Advisory Stage of 12.0 feet by later Thursday morning. Therefore, a Flood Advisory for nuisance lowland flooding will remain in effect until the Rocky River falls below bankfull levels. - Some locations that may experience flooding are low-lying areas adjacent to the Rocky River from Harrisburg...to Georgeville...to Midland.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
